editor.placeholder:
Start writing your essay here. Refer to your plan in Section 4.

Remember:
• 4 paragraphs (Introduction, Body 1, Body 2, Conclusion)

guidancePanel.title: Writing Tips
tips: Follow your plan from Section 4 - don't change structure midway
Use topic sentences to start each body paragraph
Include linking words (However, Furthermore, For instance)
Avoid contractions (don't → do not, can't → cannot)
Leave 5 minutes at the end to check for errors

sections.title: Check Your Essay
sections.description: Use this checklist to review your work

items.label: Introduction clearly paraphrases the question (not copied)
tips: Use synonyms: social media → social networking platforms, effects → impact

items.label: Body paragraph 1 has clear topic sentence about positive effects
tips: Topic sentence = first sentence stating main benefit

items.label: Body paragraph 2 discusses negative effects
tips: Use transition: However, On the other hand, Conversely

items.label: Conclusion summarizes both views + states opinion clearly
tips: Your opinion must be clear - which side do you support?

items.label: Both positive and negative views are discussed with equal detail
tips: Count sentences - each view should have similar length

items.label: Personal opinion is clearly stated
tips: Use: In my view, I believe that, From my perspective

items.label: Specific examples are provided for each view
tips: Real examples like specific platforms or studies are strongest

items.label: All parts of the question are fully addressed
No repeated words - synonyms used throughout
tips: social media → platforms, networks, digital channels

items.label: Topic vocabulary from Section 2 is used correctly
Complex sentences are used (not all simple sentences)
tips: Use: who, which, that, although, while, because

items.label: Verb tenses are consistent and correct

sections.title: Band 8 Model Answer
sections.description: Compare your essay with this high-band example

essay.fullEssay:
The influence of social networking platforms on contemporary society has become a contentious issue, with advocates highlighting their benefits while critics emphasize their harmful consequences. While these platforms offer valuable connectivity, I believe their negative impacts on mental health and public discourse are increasingly problematic.

On the one hand, social media provides unprecedented opportunities for global communication and social change. These platforms enable people to maintain relationships across vast distances and connect with like-minded individuals worldwide, fostering communities that transcend geographical boundaries. Furthermore, social networking sites have become powerful tools for advocacy and awareness, amplifying voices that might otherwise go unheard. For instance, environmental movements and social justice campaigns have successfully mobilized millions of supporters through coordinated social media efforts. Additionally, these platforms create valuable business opportunities, allowing entrepreneurs and small companies to reach target audiences without expensive traditional marketing.

However, the negative consequences of social media are substantial and growing. Mental health professionals increasingly link platform usage to rising rates of anxiety, depression, and addiction, particularly among young people who engage in constant social comparison and face cyberbullying. Moreover, the rapid spread of misinformation through social networks poses serious risks to public health and democratic processes. During the COVID-19 pandemic, for example, false health claims proliferated faster than factual information, creating widespread confusion and potentially dangerous behavior. The algorithmic amplification of divisive content has also contributed to societal polarization, creating echo chambers that reinforce existing beliefs rather than encouraging constructive dialogue.

In conclusion, while social media facilitates valuable global connections and activism, its detrimental effects on mental well-being and information integrity represent serious societal challenges that require urgent regulatory attention and digital literacy education.

strengths: Clear position stated with nuanced understanding
Both views discussed equally with specific examples
Strong topic sentences in each paragraph
Wide range of vocabulary (contentious, proliferated, amplification)
Complex sentence structures with varied grammar

annotations.highlight: The influence of social networking platforms on contemporary society...
annotations.explanation: Transforms 'social media effects on society' into sophisticated academic language using 'influence', 'platforms', and 'contemporary'.

annotations.highlight: On the one hand... However, the negative consequences...
annotations.explanation: Explicit transitions guide the examiner through your balanced argument structure.

annotations.highlight: For instance, environmental movements and social justice campaigns...
annotations.explanation: Concrete, current examples demonstrate real-world understanding and strengthen task response.
Using different linking words shows linguistic range and maintains reader interest.
Academic vocabulary used naturally demonstrates strong lexical resource without appearing forced.

annotations.highlight: platforms enable people to maintain relationships across vast distances and connect with like-minded individuals worldwide, fostering communities that transcend geographical boundaries
annotations.explanation: Sophisticated grammar combining multiple ideas with participial phrase 'fostering' shows advanced control.
